title.romaji: Re:Zero kara Hajimeru Isekai Seikatsu 2nd Season Part 2
title.english: Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World- Season 2 Part 2

description:
After learning more behind the Death Loop and Witches of Sin, Subaru vows to save Emilia and his friends from further doom.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: Re: 제로부터 시작하는 이세계 생활 2기 파트 2

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Witch
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a witch.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Cult
tags.description: Features a social group with unorthodox religious, spiritual, or philosophical beliefs and practices.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Hikikomori
tags.description: Prominently features a character who withdraws from social life, often seeking extreme isolation.

tags.name: Monster Boy
tags.description: Prominently features a male character who is a part-monster.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

**[Website](https://mayumaeshima.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_0414mayu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_0414mayu/)**

Japanese singer. She was the lead vocalist of the music unit [MYTH & ROID](https://anilist.co/staff/119976) from 2015 to 2017. She made her major debut as a solo artist in 2019. Her first solo single "Long shot" was released on February 24, 2021 under KADOKAWA, and was used as the second opening theme to the second season of the anime series [Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World](https://anilist.co/anime/119661).

__Hometown:__ Saitama City, Saitama Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Omiya Koryo High School and SHOBI College of Music

[Profile (One Music)](https://one-music.jp/suehiro/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kenichiro_s) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kenichiro.suehiro)

A Japanese pianist, composer, and arranger.

Formerly affiliated with [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/) and [Ordet](https://anilist.co/studio/334/). He was one of the people to follow [Yutaka Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/101655/) to Ordet after its establishment. After leaving Kyoto Animation he primarily used the pen name Gorou Sessha and became well known for his work in the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) franchise. His directorial debut was [Naruto: Rock Lee & His Ninja Pals](https://anilist.co/anime/12979/) which he directed from episode 27 onwards under the supervision of [Masahiko Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/102608/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/saifu1low)

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Agency:__ 81 Produce

[Website](https://taka8rie.com/) | [Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=236) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/taka8rie/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/taka8rie) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/riery_syame/) | [YouTube](https://m.youtube.com/channel/UC9xUIUtv3pyt_s_LtCLWP_Q) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rie_Takahashi) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%AB%98%E6%A9%8B%E6%9D%8E%E4%BE%9D)

A voice actress and singer. She won a Best Female Newcomer Award at the 10th Seiyuu Awards in 2016.

She is part of the idol group [Earphones](https://anilist.co/staff/195973/) with fellow voice actresses [Marika Kouno](https://anilist.co/staff/119383) and [Yuki Nagaku](https://anilist.co/staff/119370), originally formed for the anime [Sore ga Seiyuu!](https://anilist.co/anime/21009).

**Non anime roles:**
- [Hu Tao](https://anilist.co/character/233425/) - Genshin Impact (Video Game)
- [Hikari](https://anilist.co/character/3966/Hikari) - Pokémon Masters EX (Video Game)
- Benten - Soul Tide (Video Game)
- Huma - Tower of Fantasy (Video Game)
- Diesel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (Video Game)
- Erina - Persona 5 Tactica (Video Game)
- Ren - Date a Live: Ren Dystopia (Video Game)
- Kokona - Strinova (Video Game)
- Perfumer - Arknights (Video Game)

__[Website](http://higedriver.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/higedriver)__

Hige Driver, alternatively known as Shingo, is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of HigedriveVAN. He is affiliated with the creator team [Heart's Cry](https://anilist.co/staff/252231/).

On August 10th, 2020, his marriage to voice actress [Ari Ozawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118663) was announced.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

__[Profile (Verygoo)](http://www.verygoo.jp/artists/ron/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ron_sdf)__

__Ryuuta Iida__, also known by his stage name Ron (stylized as R・O・N) is a Japanese musician, arranger, composer, lyricist, sound producer, guitarist, keyboardist and singer. He was the sound producer and guitarist of Japanese rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) along with seiyuu [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735) from 2009-2012.

He currently works under the artist management company Verygoo, has a solo vocal project called [Stereo Dive Foundation](https://anilist.co/staff/118710/Stereo-Dive-Foundation), is a member of the rock band [ROSARYHILL](http://rosaryhill.net/) (2008-) as a keyboardist and vocalist, and works as a music creator for the creative music unit [(K)NoW_NAME](https://anilist.co/staff/126602/KNoW-NAME).

[Profile (TaWaRa)](http://www.ta-wa-ra.com/creator/%e3%83%86%e3%82%b9%e3%83%88) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomoshima_th) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tom_oshima/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom-H@ck) Introduction Tomohiro Oshima, better known by stage name Tom-H@ck, is a Japanese guitarist, producer, composer and arranger. He is also a member of, and a production manager for the groups OxT and MYTH & ROID. Biography His musical interest started when he was 9-years-old, as its when he got to experience playing a musical instrument for the first time in his life. Later at the age of 15, he gained more experience, but this time he got to play a guitar instead, and at the same time he also started to compose music. He started to work as a composer, an arranger and a guitarist for the company Far East Peach, where he worked as a sound creator. As of 2016 he has mainly been active in the joint unit with artist Ooishi Masayoshi, titled OxT (Ooishi x Tom-H@ck), and in the band MYTH & ROID. He's also representative director for TaWaRa Co, LTD, which he established with his own production team from F.M.F Co, LTD. Affiliations - TaWaRa Co, LTD. (2016-) - OxT (2015-) - MYTH & ROID (2015-) - Flyingpan Records (2012-) - F.M.F Corporation (Source: Wikipedia)

He is also a member of, and a production manager for the groups OxT and MYTH & ROID. [Official Website ](http://www.mami-kawada.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mamikawada) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5MqHx3rECV1BvBBFG3L508?autoplay=true) 

Mami Kawada is a former Japanese pop singer and lyricist who was signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan and also a member of I've Sound, a musical group which produces soundtracks for eroge (erotic games) and anime.

Kawada made her musical debut in 2001 after being discovered by her music teacher [Eiko Shimamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100243/Eiko-Shimamiya) with the release of the song "Kaze to Kimi o Daite". She released her first single, a split-single with musician [KOTOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO), in 2002, and her first solo single was released in 2005. Her first album, Seed, was released in 2006. She first performed overseas in Taiwan in 2007 and later appeared at the Bangkok Comic Con in Thailand in 2014.

Kawada's songs have been featured as theme music for various anime shows such as the Shakugan no Shana and A Certain Magical Index series. She has performed theme songs for various eroge such as Love, Election and Chocolate and Aokana: Four Rhythm Across the Blue. She has also written songs for other musicians. During the LisAni 2016 event, Kawada announced her retirement from singing activities following a final concert in May 2016.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Nakazawa0109)

Tomoyuki Nakazawa is a Japanese composer, arranger and music producer. He is a former member of the music unit I've.
